ch4.tcp
Class TCPSegment

java.lang.Object
  ch4.tcp.TCPSegment
public class TCPSegment
extends java.lang.Object

TCP segment, which could carry either data, ACK, or both. Notice that the segment has no data field since data are irrelevant for the purpose of the current simulation. If your simulation requires data, the data field should be added.

Author:
Ivan Marsic

Field Summary
 boolean ack
          Informs whether or not this segment contains ACK.
 boolean inError
          Indicates whether this segment is corrupted by an error.
 int length
          Segment length [in bytes].
 int ordinalNum
          Ordinal number of this segment.
 int seqNum
          Sequence number of this segment, which is the sequence number of the first byte of data carried in this segment.

Field Detail

ack

public boolean ack
Informs whether or not this segment contains ACK.

inError

public boolean inError
Indicates whether this segment is corrupted by an error. This is invented in lieu of building a full-fledged error-checking mechanism. If a router or channel wants to damage this packet, it just sets the flag to true.

length

public int length
Segment length [in bytes].

ordinalNum

public int ordinalNum
Ordinal number of this segment. This is only for tracking purposes and this field is not present in an actual TCP segment.

seqNum

public int seqNum
Sequence number of this segment, which is the sequence number of the first byte of data carried in this segment.
